intro: Ternstroemia tepezapote, commonly known as the Mexican evergreen or tepezapote, is a member of the Theaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds. Ternstroemia tepezapote is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical forests.
